prompt: Create a CSS flexbox layout with centered content
response:
Here's how you can create a CSS flexbox layout with centered content: ```css .container { display: flex; justify-content: center; /* Center horizontally */ align-items: center; /* Center vertically */ height: 100vh; /* Full viewport height */ } ``` And here's an example of how to use this in HTML: ```html CSS Flexbox Centered Content

Hello, World!

``` In this example: - The `.container` class is applied to a `div`. - It uses flexbox properties to center its content both horizontally and vertically. - The `height: 100vh;` ensures the container takes up the full height of the viewport, making it easier to see the centered effect.
